ContentIntroduction: Doval is a social network dedicated to gastronomy that allows you to discover, share and enjoy food. You can order food, react to posts and chat with other users. These Terms and Conditions govern the use of Doval. By using Doval, you agree to these Terms and Conditions.
UseOfDovalContent: You can use Doval to: Search and order food from local restaurants. Share photos and videos of your favorite meals. React to other users' posts with "Like", "Dislike", and comments. Chat with other users.
ContentContent: You are responsible for the content you post on Doval. You should not post content that is: Illegal, harmful, threatening, abusive, defamatory, obscene, pornographic, discriminatory, or that invades the privacy of others. Spam or unsolicited advertising. False or misleading. Doval reserves the right to remove any content that violates these Terms and Conditions.
OrdersContent: When you place an order through Doval, you accept the terms and conditions of the restaurant. Doval is not responsible for the quality of the food or customer service.
PrivacyContent: Doval collects personal information about you, such as your name, email, and address. Doval uses this information to provide you with the service and improve your experience. Doval will not share your personal information with third parties without your consent.
IntellectualPropertyContent: Doval is owned by Doval Inc. The content of Doval is protected by copyright and other intellectual property laws. You may not copy, distribute, or modify the content of Doval without the consent of Doval.
IndemnificationContent: You agree to indemnify and defend Doval from any damage, loss, or cost arising from your use of Doval.
ChangesToTermsTitle: Changes to the Terms and Conditions
ChangesToTermsContent: Doval may modify these Terms and Conditions at any time. We will notify you of any significant changes by email or through a notification in the app.
DisputesContent: Any dispute arising from these Terms and Conditions will be resolved through binding arbitration.
AcceptanceContent: By using Doval, you accept these Terms and Conditions.
PrivacyPolicyContent: Doval is committed to protecting your privacy. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, and share your personal information.
InformationWeCollectContent: We collect personal information about you when you use Doval, such as: Your name, email, and address. Information about your device, such as the IP address and the type of device. Information about your activity on Doval, such as the posts you view and interact with.
HowWeUseYourInformationContent: We use your personal information to: Provide you with the Doval service. Improve your experience on Doval. Send you marketing communications. Protect Doval from fraud and abuse.
HowWeShareYourInformationContent: We do not share your personal information with third parties without your consent. However, we may share your personal information with: Service providers that help us provide the Doval service. Legal authorities if required by law.
YourChoicesContent: You have choices about how we collect and use your personal information. You can: Access your personal information and update it. Opt out of marketing communications. Request that we delete your personal information.
SecurityContent: We take steps to protect your personal information from unauthorized access, use, or disclosure. However, no security measure is perfect, and we cannot guarantee the total security of your personal information.
ChangesToPrivacyPolicyContent: Doval may modify this Privacy Policy at any time. We will notify you of any significant changes by email or through a notification in the app.
QuestionsContent: If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, you can contact us through the Doval app.
AcceptanceOfPrivacyPolicyContent: By using Doval, you accept this Privacy Policy.
CopyrightPolicyContent: Doval respects the copyright of others and expects its users to do the same. This Copyright Policy sets out the norms and procedures for reporting and resolving alleged copyright infringements on Doval.
CopyrightProtectedContentContent: Doval contains various types of copyright-protected content, including: Texts, photos, videos, music, images, and other original creative works. Trademarks, logos, and designs owned by Doval or third parties.
PermittedUseContent: You may share copyright-protected content on Doval in the following cases: With the express permission of the copyright owner. Under the doctrine of fair use for purposes such as criticism, comment, parody, research, or education. In the case of content published under an open license that allows sharing and modifying the content under certain terms.
CopyrightInfringementProcessContent: If you believe that your copyright is being infringed on Doval, you can file a complaint by following these steps: Provide clear and precise information about the copyright-protected material that is allegedly being infringed. Identify the location of the infringing material on Doval (e.g., link to the post). Provide your contact information, including your name, email address, and postal address. Provide proof that you are the owner of the copyright-protected material or that you are authorized to file the complaint on behalf of the owner. Sign the complaint electronically or physically. Send your complaint to the following address: Doval Inc. Attn: Copyright Agent [Physical address of Doval Inc.] [Contact email of Doval Inc.]
CopyrightInfringementConsequencesContent: Doval reserves the right to remove any content that violates the Copyright Policy. In the case of repeated infringements, Doval may suspend or cancel the infringing user's account.
ChangesToCopyrightPolicyContent: Doval may modify this Copyright Policy at any time. We will notify you of any significant changes by email or through a notification in the app.
CopyrightDisputesContent: Any dispute related to the Copyright Policy will be resolved in accordance with the laws of the [applicable jurisdiction].
CopyrightAcceptanceContent: By using Doval, you accept this Copyright Policy.

Videos containing offensive language, di: Videos containing offensive language, disturbing images, or any content considered inappropriate.
Videos showing acts of violence, abuse,: Videos showing acts of violence, abuse, or any dangerous activity that may incite harmful behavior.
Videos promoting hate or discrimination: Videos promoting hate or discrimination against individuals or groups based on race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, disability, or other attributes
Videos containing nudity, sexual acts, o: Videos containing nudity, sexual acts, or sexually explicit content.
Videos considered spam, unsolicited cont: Videos considered spam, unsolicited content, or misleading content intended to scam or deceive users
Videos infringing on someone else's copy: Videos infringing on someone else's copyright, including unauthorized reproduction of copyrighted material.
Videos containing threats, harassment, o: Videos containing threats, harassment, or intimidation towards individuals or groups.
Videos spreading false information, rumo: Videos spreading false information, rumors, or misleading content that may cause confusion or harm.
Videos inciting hate, violence, or illeg: Videos inciting hate, violence, or illegal actions against specific individuals or groups.
Videos showing personal or private infor: Videos showing personal or private information of a person without their consent.
Videos not suitable for minors, includin: Videos not suitable for minors, including graphic, violent, or explicit content.
